reviewText: Don't listen to those noisy negativists! This is a great dvd, one of the best I've found! Terrific footage, over 250 clips!  Interviews with Bob Lazaar, Roger Leir, Gordon Cooper, Linda Howe and more!  See saucers, probes, and the surgical removal of an alien implant from an abductee - simply a must-have!
summary: OUTSTANDING presentation!  A cut above the norm!

reviewText: The videos, and some photos, of this DVD are 'analyzed' or 'probed' by a supposed footage analyst who is shockingly consistently embarrassing:THE SWEDEN UFOOne of the most striking UFO videos, this was tricky.Was it a glowing blimp? It suspiciously just floated along.No, it was a small boat, and you are looking at the water.That explains the narrow longer end and blinking light. You can almost see the horizon.Maybe the prankster gangster who filmed it or sold it put the brightness up to make the floating object 'glow.'THE LONDON LANDING:Helicopter searchlight.That's why you see cars through it.As you can see, it's filmed from the air.That 'probe' that has jumped as far away from the 'UFO' as the analyst's logic and sight has, is probably the back of vehicle, maybe a motor bike. It has a red tinge.PROBESAlready busted by the other reviewer.This is the lowest form of name-calling. Calling everything a probe.A satellite. Or Venus - which is the first thought of the video with lightning, and is not pulsating but is atmospheric effect everyone sees when the star is low.GUARDIAN UFOSAlready debunked as landed helicopters I think.MOON PHOTO WITH UFOMoon with Earth.Very tricky. Took a long time. And shows how easily fooled you can be even when you are essentially skeptical.2 UFOS ON MOONThis really is as lame as the moon conspiracy irrationality.But I can't figure what part of the spacecraft - err, human spacecraft - it is.In this video you can see the sun and horizon briefly before it's conveniently kept out of view, as if a camera was being set up.1978 NEW ZEALAND UFO CASEThis here defines perfectly the logic of this whole program, and the narrator who also doesn't seem to mind being mindless.That famous frame of the nighttime UFO which is accompanied by the estimate of unearthly speed - of the nervous guy's handheld cam in a shaky plane.________IMPLANTSNow the creme-de-la-alien.Dr. Roger Leir always creeps me out, as if I can't trust him, and I cannot solve this implant junk as easily as cattle has been.But first, it's foreign matter - from earth, maybe from a fall or hitting something. How to explain the non-earth composition?  How many fragments of meteorites there must be lying around.How would a piece of meteorite serve any function? No circuitry, nothing. So that alone almost proves it is delusion.It has not been cross-referenced with biological experts. Just the scientific analysis data.So this Leir guy takes it on his own that these are alien, with no second or real opinion. Just him. No one else.Plus it could be faked.Conclusion: Crackpot.REAL BITSThis doesn't leave much, but those with actual experience who talk. And the few good photos we have all seen before. Yep, there is not one video in this shameful mess, let alone that is newer.Lazaar is always compelling and fantastically believable, yet again alone.Dr. Leir's talking of the piece of the alien craft that crashed at Roswell could finally seem a valid input too, if it could be trusted.
summary: CLOSE ENCOUNTERS: Proof of Human Contact
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD and "Out of The Blue" are certainly the most satisfying documentaries on the UFO subject. Don't let the silly cover design fool you, this is quality content. The video footage alone is worth the price.Once you see these UFOs captured on tape, you don't need a narrator or eye-witness accounts to convince you something extraordinary is in the skies. I'm not convinced by the surgery portion of this doc. because the findings of that doctor were effectively challeged on a Sci-Fi network show, but as a skeptic, the videos will certainly open your eyes.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a believer in life on other planets and have been a believer since I was a teenager so this DVD just reinforced my beliefs.The most compelling parts of this DVD is when Gordon Cooper, a former astronaut, is interviewed and he recalls UFO's he encountered in space.  He says most astronauts have seen this, it's normal.  I believe he is a credible resource and is seen as a hero by many.  I doubt he would lie and make himself look like a fool to skeptics.  I believe every word he said, of course our NASA astronauts have encountered UFO's!The interview with Bob Lazar blew my mind.  He's a former government scientist that has worked on Area 51.  He says some crazy stuff about work he has done for our government.  He explains how he has been inside an alien space craft that crashed on our planet.  He examined it, studied it.  I believe he's telling the truth.  I have studied psychology and can tell when someone is lying.  There are slight body movement changes, eye movement changes.  I did not see any movements that would indicate to me that these two people were lying.The other material on this video I did not find as interesting or compelling.  It appears to be UFO footage to me, but it looks like stuff I've seen on other UFO programs.The part where foreign materials are being taken out of people, I don't know how true that is.All in all, this DVD fascinated me. If you are a UFO enthusiast or curious about life on other planets this will be a good addition to your collection.  I wish it were longer, it's 70 minutes, but the price is fair for what you get.
